page.title: 04STRAWBERRIES IN FENLAND
page.content: In 1985 atrocious spring weather delayed the local{strawberry}crop.At the end of June, N.F.U. Cambridgeshire horticultural secretary Mr. Godfrey said,"The crop is already a fortnight late and warmth and sunshine are needed to swell the fruit.It looks like being a short season and an average crop." He also stated that local canners would be ordering less strawberries this year, though firms which freeze fruit might be ordering more. The managing director of Smedleys and Lockwoods, two local processing plants, confirmed that demand is steadily{declining.}It is a trend which has seen acreages of strawberries in the Fenland area reduced by 40% in the last few years. The average price per ton this season is around Â£400.
